title.narrative: Sao Paulo State Sustainable Transport Project

description.narrative: Contribute to the improvement of the State’s transport and logistics efficiency and safety while enhancing the Borrower’s capacity in environmental and disaster risk management.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Cooperation agreement | Description :Prior to the carrying out of any Project activity which requires theassistance of any given Beneficiary Entity, the Borrower shall enter into a cooperation agreement (the “Cooperation Agreement”),satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date :31-Mar-2014

Finance Agreement :Environment and Social Provisions | Description :The Borrower shall cause DER-SP, with assistance ofParticipating Entity, to implement the Project in accordance with the provisions of the Environmental and Social Impact Assessment,each Environmental Management Plan, the Pest Management Framework, the Resettlement Policy Framework, each Resettlement ActionPlan, the Process Framework and the Indigenous People Planning Framework. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Institutional arrangement [Schedule 2, Section I.A.1.(a)] | Description :The State shall maintain through theimplementation of the Project, a Project coordination unit (the PCU) within DER-SP, headed by a Project coordinator, with astructure, functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Institutional arrangement [Schedule 2, Section I.A.1.(b)] | Description :60 days upon Effectiveness, the Stateshall hire a management consulting firm, staffed with a core team consisting of, at least, one procurement specialist, 1 financialmanagement specialist, 1 road engineer and 1 structure engineer, under TOR acceptable to the Bank, to provide the PCU withtechnical assistance on financial, procurement and administrative matters during implementation. | Due Date :15-Nov-2013

Finance Agreement :Mid-term review | Description :By October 31, 2016, or when disbursements have reached 50% of the Loan,whichever is first, the Borrower shall:(a) carry out jointly with the Bank, a mid-term review (Midterm Review) on the progress inthe implementation of the Project; and(b) immediately following such Midterm Review, act promptly and diligently to take anycorrective action as shall be agreed between the Borrower and Bank. | Due Date :31-Oct-2016

Finance Agreement :Subsidiary agreement | Description :Prior to effectiveness the Borrower shall enter into a subsidiary agreementwith the Implementing Agency (DER-SP), under terms and conditions approved by the Bank. | Due Date :30-Sep-2013

title.narrative: Contingency plans established for selected UBAs
Change in average Vehicle Operating Costs on project roads
Number of Municipalities in the Sao Paulo Metropolitan region with a concluded Disaster Risk mapping
Number of fatalities on the 100 most critical spots of the State road network
Size of the total classified network
Number of days required for SMA/CETESB to approve Environmental Preliminary Reports (Relatório Ambiental Preliminar – RAP) for roadworks
Roads in good and fair condition as a share of total classified roads
Development and operationalization of a Platform connecting the State Disaster Risk Management monitoring systems
Presentation of the Ecological and Economic Zoning (ZEE) to CONSEMA
